174.title: Leader like no other: Virat Kohli wishes MS Dhoni on his 41st birthday
174.article_body: Team India batter Virat Kohli took to Twitter to wish former India captain MS Dhoni on his 41st birthday on Thursday. "A leader like no other. Thanks for everything you have done for Indian cricket. You became more like an elder brother for me. Nothing but love and respect always," wrote Kohli. Dhoni celebrated his birthday in London.

175.title: GrowthX secures $1.5 million in seed funding from 212 investors
175.article_body: Bengaluru-based edtech startup GrowthX has raised $1.5 million in a seed funding round, which saw participation from 212 investors. The startup said this was the largest-ever community-led seed round as 65% of the funds were raised from its own community members. Founders and executives from companies like Razorpay, Myntra, CRED, Google, Airbnb and Lenskart invested in the round.

176.title: Maha CM Eknath Shinde's locality water-logged amid heavy rain in Thane
176.article_body: Heavy overnight rain reportedly caused water-logging at various places in Thane, including Chief Minister Eknath Shinde's locality, on Thursday. Local firemen received a call around 6:15 am about flooding near Shinde's residence, following which civic personnel rushed to the spot and cleared the flood waters, an official said. Rains also caused trees to fall in some places, he added.

177.title: Man found dead in drain amid heavy rain in Maharashtra's Palghar
177.article_body: A man was found dead in a swollen drain in Maharashtra's Palghar district amid heavy rainfall. Police said it is suspected that the man, Rahul Vishwakarma, may have slipped into the drain and got washed away. The body was highly decomposed, police said, adding that it was sent to a government hospital for post-mortem.

178.title: Very heavy to extremely heavy rainfall warning in several states; IMD releases list
178.article_body: IMD has predicted isolated extremely heavy rainfall in Goa for five days and in Telangana, Karnataka, Gujarat and Uttarakhand between July 7 and 9. Very heavy rainfall is likely over Maharashtra, Andhra Pradesh, Tamil Nadu, Puducherry, Himachal Pradesh, Punjab, Haryana, Chandigarh and south Rajasthan between July 7 and 11. IMD issued red alert for Mumbai, Thane and Palghar for tomorrow.

179.title: India curbs exports of wheat flour & related products from July 12
179.article_body: India has restricted the export of wheat flour (atta) and other related products like maida, semolina (rava) etc, making it mandatory for all such exporters to seek prior permission for the exports. A Directorate General of Foreign Trade notification said that the restrictions will come into effect from July 12. India had earlier banned wheat exports amid a heatwave.

180.title: Aarey protest not just to protect people but also the city: Cong's Aslam
180.article_body: Speaking on protest against Aarey metro car shed, Congress' Aslam Shaikh said that the protest isn't only to protect people's houses but also the city. "In three days of rains, we've witnessed [Mumbai] submerge...Forest area should be left the way it is," Shaikh added. This comes after the newly-formed Maharashtra government approved decision to relocate car shed to Aarey colony.

181.title: Pune Cantonment Board is in a precarious financial condition: New CEO
181.article_body: Pune Cantonment Board's new CEO Subrat Pal has expressed concerns over financial crunch being faced by the board. "The board is in a precarious financial condition," he said, adding that giving salaries to the staff would also be difficult if the Centre doesn't provide enough funds in next two months. The board's monthly expenditure is estimated to be ₹6 crore.

182.title: Kangana recalls her Koffee with Karan episode, says 'It was a surgical strike'
182.article_body: Kangana Ranaut took a veiled dig at Karan Johar as he gears for the premiere of 'Koffee With Karan 7'. Ahead of the episode's release, Kangana took to Instagram Stories and wrote, "Good luck to papa jo...but what about this episode oh sorry!!! surgical strike, ghar mein ghusss ke mara tha na, my episode is his most popular episode."

183.title: Man takes Mumbai woman to Bihar after kidnapping her; rapes her
183.article_body: Police have arrested a 27-year-old man for allegedly kidnapping and taking a 25-year-old Mumbai-based woman to Bihar and raping her. He kidnapped her in January 2022 when she took a train to visit North India. According to a police officer, a relative of the accused, identified as Vaisaid Nisar, was stalking the woman online and in person since November 2021.

184.title: You've to go down to hell to beat him: Taylor Fritz after loss vs Nadal
184.article_body: Following his defeat against Rafael Nadal in the quarter-finals of Wimbledon 2022, American tennis player Taylor Fritz said, "I still believe...[Nadal] can be beaten. Only, you have to go down to hell to achieve it." "This loss is the one that hurts the most...When the match was over, I felt like crying...[I've] never felt this after a loss," added Fritz.

185.title: IIT Madras develops AI tool that can predict cancer-causing genes
185.article_body: Researchers at IIT Madras have developed an artificial intelligence tool that is capable of predicting cancer-causing genes in an individual. The tool called 'PIVOT' can help in devising personalised cancer treatments, the institute said. Researchers have currently created AI prediction models for three types of cancer but they are planning to build models for more cancer types.

186.title: Security issues in Pacific should be solved locally: New Zealand PM
186.article_body: New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern on Thursday said that security challenges in the Pacific region need to be resolved locally. She also said that regional architecture such as the Pacific Islands Forum is critical in resolving local problems. Her comments come amid growing concerns in New Zealand, Australia and the US about China's growing influence in the region.

187.title: Will start centre to train underprivileged aspiring actors for free: Sood
187.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood said he'll start a centre where aspiring actors, technicians from underprivileged backgrounds will be trained for free. "[I've] seen people who come to Mumbai and cannot survive...[I want to give them] access...that a newcomer cannot get...When I came to Mumbai, I didn't have anybody to guide me...There are sharks who take advantage of the innocent," added Sood.

188.title: Had ₹1500 in my account, was like 'Can't afford to do sh*t': Anurag's daughter
188.article_body: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap's daughter Aaliyah Kashyap recalled having ₹1500 in her account after moving out. "I was like literally, 'Can't afford to do sh*t'...I literally had to tell my mom to send me food at home because I couldn't afford to even get groceries for three days. It was not a fun time, would never do that again," she added.

189.title: Alia & I've been talking about having kids from the first day we met: Ranbir
189.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor opened up about having a baby with his wife, actress Alia Bhatt. Ranbir said that he and Alia have been talking about having kids from the first day they met and fell in love and revealed that they've always wanted children. "To start a new chapter in life...I am extremely excited about that...can't wait," he added.

190.title: 3 more PFI activists arrested in Nizamabad, booked under UAPA
190.article_body: The Nizamabad Police in Telangana arrested three PFI activists on charges of allegedly attempting to create religious animosity and training youngsters in usage of lethal weapons. They were booked under UAPA and other sections of IPC. This comes after a PFI activist was arrested for training youth in martial arts in Nizamabad.

191.title: Cong blames BJP after B'luru ranked 'least liveable' city in India
191.article_body: Congress MLA Ramalinga Reddy has blamed the BJP government in Karnataka after Bengaluru was ranked the 'least liveable' city in India. He said, "[Bengaluru] has lost the ranking due to the poor quality of infrastructure, roads...For all this...BJP...[is] the reason." Bengaluru has been ranked 146 (score 54.4), the least among five Indian cities which featured on Global Liveability Index 2022.

192.title: Fake number of BBMP chief circulates online; complaint filed
192.article_body: Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner Tushar Giri Nath said that a fake number has been circulating in his name online. "Please note that 7076522681 isn't my number," Nath said, adding that some fraudster is using this number to mislead the public and officials. He also said that he has filed a complaint with Karnataka CID in this regard.

193.title: Taliban digs out Toyota car used by its former leader to escape US invasion
193.article_body: Taliban militants in Afghanistan dug out a Toyota car used by their former leader Mullah Omar to escape being targeted by US forces after the 9/11 attacks in 2001. The white Toyota Corolla was buried in a village garden in Zabul province. "It is still in good condition, only its front is a bit damaged," Taliban militant Rahmatullah Hammad said.

194.title: Biden speaks with wife of US basketball player detained in Russia
194.article_body: US President Joe Biden spoke with the wife of basketball player Brittney Griner, who's being detained in Russia on drug charges, the White House said. Biden assured Cherelle Griner that he's working to secure Brittney's release "as soon as possible". This comes after Brittney, in a handwritten letter to Biden, said that she fears she'll be detained in Russia indefinitely.

195.title: Was like being in the middle of a war zone: Moeen on 2022 CL final chaos
195.article_body: Sharing his experience at France's Stade de France before the 2022 Champions League final between Liverpool and Real Madrid, English cricketer Moeen Ali said, "It was...like being in the middle of a war zone." "We had...kids...and they were crying, it was horrible...I didn't feel safe...Pepper spray, crushing, police with shields, fights...I just wanted to get home," added Moeen.

196.title: PMPML to install boom barriers at 148 junctions on BRTS routes
196.article_body: The Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Ltd (PMPML) has decided to install 148 automatic boom barriers on Bus Rapid Transit System (BRTS) routes in the city. "PMPML hopes to bring a check on private vehicles entering dedicated BRTS lanes by installing automatic boom barriers...They will be operated on a number plate recognition-based access control and monitoring system," an official said.

197.title: JNU not a place to pursue political aspirations: VC
197.article_body: Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) Vice Chancellor Santishree Dhulipudi Pandit on Wednesday said that JNU is not a place for pursuing political aspirations. "Language is a sensitive issue, pushing a particular language too hard could lead to regionalism," she added. She claimed that 90% of JNU students are apolitical and only 10% are "troublemakers".

198.title: FIR against ex-Kerala minister Saji Cherian over anti-Constitution remarks
198.article_body: An FIR was lodged on Thursday at Keezhvaipur Police Station against former Kerala Culture Minister Saji Cherian over anti-Constitution remarks. Cherian on Wednesday resigned from the state Cabinet amid protests over his remarks. The Constitution endorses exploitation and loot of common people, he had said. "The news that I criticised the Constitution is twisted," Cherian later said.

199.title: Mohammed Zubair approaches Supreme Court against UP Police FIR
199.article_body: Alt News Co-founder Mohammed Zubair has moved the Supreme Court for quashing of a hate speech FIR registered against him in Uttar Pradesh's Sitapur. He has also moved the court for pre-arrest bail. Zubair's lawyer Colin Gonsalves has approached the apex court against the Allahabad High Court's decision to not quash the FIR against him on June 13.

200.title: 5 pet puppies of 69-yr-old woman killed by poisoning in Mumbai
200.article_body: Five pet puppies belonging to a 69-year-old woman were allegedly killed by poisoning in Mumbai's Kandivali. The woman said that her puppies suddenly fell ill and died with foam and blood coming out of their mouths. She suspects that her 35-year-old neighbour, who frequently used to pick fights with her over the pets, might have killed the dogs.

201.title: Twitter should check tweets by perverted mentality people: MP minister
201.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra has said he will write to Twitter on tweets hurting religious sentiments, adding, "Twitter should check tweets posted by people having perverted mentality, like...'Kaali' film director, Leena Manimekalai." He will also write to the central government to issue a lookout circular against Manimekalai "as whatever she is doing appears to be deliberate".

202.title: Kohli not a certainty in India's T20I side: Wasim Jaffer
202.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said Virat Kohli's form will be "taken into consideration" in the upcoming T20Is against England. "Kohli has not been in the best of forms...I don't think he'll be a certainty because so many young players have done so well," stated Jaffer. Kohli will be available for the second and third T20I against England.

203.title: My political tenure not yet completed: Naqvi after resigning as Union Minister
203.article_body: A day after resigning as the Union Cabinet Minister of Minority Affairs, Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi on Thursday said that his political and social tenure has not yet been completed. “I understand that my tenure in Rajya Sabha has been completed...I will continue to work with dedication and concern for society,” he added.

204.title: Siddaramaiah's govt was unresponsive to many scams: K'taka CM Bommai
204.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Wednesday said the government led by Congress leader Siddaramaiah was unresponsive to many scams related to recruitment tests and PU (pre-university) exams. "It was a government that covered up many such scams," Bommai added. The scam related to PU exams, involving ₹18 crore, was buried without taking any action against the culprits, Bommai alleged.

205.title: BJP sending army of trolls to spread false info about SC judges: Cong
205.article_body: The Congress accused BJP of promoting personal attacks on Supreme Court judges and making campaigns to pressurise and influence free decision-making of the judiciary. "An army of trolls is sent out by BJP to fabricate and disseminate false information about the judges and altered photos are published to suggest a false closeness with Congress leaders," party spokesperson Abhishek Singhvi said.

206.title: Gita Gopinath becomes the only woman to feature on the wall of former IMF Chief Economists
206.article_body: Gita Gopinath, the First Deputy Managing Director at the IMF, has become the first woman whose portrait was featured on the wall of former Chief Economists of the IMF. "Breaking the trend...I joined the wall of former Chief Economists of the IMF," tweeted Gopinath sharing two photos. She served as the Chief Economist of the Fund from 2019 to 2022.

207.title: ALLEN sues 20 ex-educators for alleged breach of contract: Report
207.article_body: ALLEN Career Institute has sued 20 of its former educators for alleged breach of employee agreements, media reports said. The platform alleged that the teachers breached the service agreement by not serving a four-month notice period and not completing their service tenure. However, a Jaipur court dismissed plea against five educators who argued the clauses were against basic employees' rights.

208.title: Mentally unstable man beats 62-yr-old priest to death in Delhi
208.article_body: A mentally unstable man allegedly thrashed a 62-year-old priest to death in Delhi's Sonia Vihar, police said on Thursday. The accused, identified as Sonu Bhatt, was reportedly assaulted by locals following the incident and is currently in a hospital. After preliminary investigation, police found that Bhatt is not in a "healthy state of mind" and was known to the deceased.

209.title: Go now: New UK Finance Minister as he asks PM Johnson to resign
209.article_body: Britain's new Finance Minister Nadhim Zahawi has told Boris Johnson to resign, less than 48 hours after the PM promoted him to the job. "He is now undermining the incredible achievements of this government. The country deserves a government that is not only stable, but which acts with integrity," Zahawi said. Over 50 MPs have resigned form Johnson's government.

210.title: Actor Sreejith Ravi arrested for allegedly flashing his genitals at 2 minor girls
210.article_body: Actor Sreejith Ravi, who appears in Malayalam and Tamil films, has been arrested for allegedly flashing his genitals at two minor girls at a park in Ayyanthole in Kerala's Thrissur. The Thrissur West Police has registered a case under POCSO Act against him. Following the complaint by the girls, CCTV footage examined by the police confirmed the man was Sreejith.

211.title: Biden to revoke Afghanistan’s designation as major non-NATO ally
211.article_body: US President Joe Biden in a letter to Congress on Wednesday said that he intends to rescind the designation of Afghanistan as a major non-NATO ally. Afghanistan was given the status in 2012. The move comes after the Taliban took control of Afghanistan last year after the US withdrew its troops from the country following 20 years of war.

212.title: 'Kaali' director posts pic of people dressed as God, Goddess smoking amid poster issue
212.article_body: Amid controversy over the poster of her movie 'Kaali', director Leena Manimekalai posted a picture showing people dressed as God and Goddess smoking. Meanwhile, microblogging site Twitter has removed the July 2 tweet of the filmmaker which depicted an actress dressed as Goddess Kaali smoking.

213.title: Won't stop work on Eastern Rajasthan Canal Project: CM Ashok Gehlot
213.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Wednesday said his government won't stop work on the Eastern Rajasthan Canal Project (ERCP). His comments came after Jal Shakti Ministry asked Rajasthan government to hold the project citing "lack of consent on interstate issues". "Water is [of] the state...the catchment area is ours...who're you to tell us to stop the project?" Gehlot further said.

214.title: Why not call 3rd one to shoot too: Big B on Ajay, Rohit's 'Bol Bachchan' pic
214.article_body: As 'Bol Bachchan' completed ten years, actor Ajay Devgn shared a picture of himself with filmmaker Rohit Shetty. Actor Amitabh Bachchan, who was seen in the film's title song, commented on the post saying, "Oh man, why won't you call the third one to shoot as well." The film also featured actor Abhishek Bachchan and actresses Asin and Prachi Desai.

215.title: EAM Jaishankar holds 1-hour meet with China's Foreign Minister on border issues in Bali
215.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar met China's Foreign Minister Wang Yi in Bali on the sidelines of G-20 Foreign Ministers' Meeting. Jaishankar tweeted, "Discussion lasted one hour. Focused on specific outstanding issues in our bilateral relationship pertaining to the border situation." The EAM added that they also discussed other matters including students and flights.

216.title: More than 50 Members of Parliament quit UK PM's government in less than 48 hours
216.article_body: More than 50 Members of Parliament have quit UK PM Boris Johnson's government in less than 48 hours. Johnson sacked Michael Gove from his cabinet post on Wednesday night after the leader told the PM to resign. Among those who have stepped down are Sajid Javid who was serving as Health Secretary and Finance Minister Rishi Sunak.

217.title: Fintech firms, NBFCs funded by Chinese money generated ₹950-cr slush funds in India: ED
217.article_body: Several fintech companies and non-banking financial companies (NBFCs) backed by Chinese funds generated proceeds of crime worth nearly ₹950 crore by indulging in predatory lending activities and violating RBI guidelines in India, the ED said. The ED has mounted a crackdown on such companies who, it said, were "operating on the basis of instructions from Chinese, Hong Kong persons".

218.title: Pant has improved remarkably as a keeper like MS Dhoni did: Manjrekar
218.article_body: Ex-India batter Sanjay Manjrekar said he was earlier sceptical about Rishabh Pant's ability as a keeper in English conditions, but termed his keeping during the Tests against England as "strikingly brilliant". "Pant has taken the job very seriously and his improvement has...been remarkable, just like [Dhoni's was]...The big news for India is the growth of Pant, the wicketkeeper," added Manjrekar.

219.title: Govt launches indigenously made motor & controller tech for e-rickshaws
219.article_body: The government has launched an indigenous, efficient, affordable and certified BLDC motor and smart controller technology for e-rickshaws developed by IIT Kharagpur. The technology was developed under the electronics and IT ministry's programme for the indigenous development of electric vehicle subsystems. It was transferred to Brushless Motor India for commercial production.

220.title: Bagga sends flowers to CM Mann on getting married, shares screenshot
220.article_body: BJP leader Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga sent flower bouquet to Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on his wedding. He posted the screenshot of his order worth ₹568 on his Twitter handle and wrote, "Sent flowers and Best wishes message to Bhagwant Mann ji on his wedding." Bagga had earlier criticised CM Mann for spending on advertisements of Punjab government's paperless budget.

221.title: Real consumers of Skin Foods Glow Mix feature with Malaika Arora: Kapiva
221.article_body: Kapiva's Glow Mix consumers Aishwarya & Krishna featured alongside Malaika on ELLE, showcasing their confidence from healthy glowing skin and emphasizing that skin needs inner nutrition beyond creams & serums. Malaika's secret for healthy skin is 10+ Ayurvedic herbs in Glow Mix that boost collagen production, naturally leading to healthy, glowing, clearer skin that boosts confidence, said Kapiva.

222.title: When you have big squad, it's difficult to determine the XI: Zaheer
222.article_body: Ahead of India's first T20I against England, ex-India pacer Zaheer Khan has said India should begin selecting players for the T20 World Cup in Australia later this year. "When you have such a big squad, it becomes difficult to determine which players should play," stated Zaheer. "The team [management] have to see what sort of combination they finalise," he added.

223.title: WHO calls emergency meeting as global monkeypox cases cross 6,000
223.article_body: The World Health Organization said that over 6,000 cases of monkeypox have now been reported from 58 countries, with over 80% of the cases in Europe. The agency will reconvene a meeting of the emergency committee "in the week of July 18 or sooner" to reassess whether the outbreak constitutes a public health emergency, WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said.

224.title: 66 Shiv Sena corporators from Thane join Maha CM Shinde's camp
224.article_body: As many as 66 Shiv Sena corporators from Thane, led by former mayor Naresh Muske, visited Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde's official residence at Nandanvan and joined his camp. Former Amravati Lok Sabha MP, Anandrao Vithoba Adsul, also resigned as a Sena leader. Shiv Sena is currently divided into two camps, one led by Uddhav Thackeray and the other by Shinde.

225.title: They told me I needed to retire vs Fritz, don't know if I'll play semis: Nadal
225.article_body: Rafael Nadal has revealed that his team asked him to retire during his quarter-final win against Taylor Fritz due to his abdominal injury. "It's something that I hate to do. So, I just kept trying," he added. However, on being asked about his chances of playing the semi-final against Nick Kyrgios, Nadal said, "I can't give you a clear answer."

226.title: Murmu as President a matter of pride for country: Maha CM Eknath Shinde
226.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde said tribal community member Droupadi Murmu's nomination for the Presidential election is a matter of pride for our country. "PM Modi has given an opportunity to Murmu to become the...President. It's a matter of pride and honour," he said. "I am also proud that a tribal community member has been nominated for the post," he added.

227.title: I worry for India, they don't have bowling options: Vaughan on T20 WC
227.article_body: Talking about the upcoming T20 World Cup 2022, ex-England captain Michael Vaughan said he is "worried" about India not having enough bowling options. "It is about trying to find players in the top five, who can offer you overs. Maybe Hardik Pandya bats in the top five," added Vaughan. "They have got to find a better mechanism," he stated.

228.title: Sky turns green in several US' cities after powerful storm, pics go viral
228.article_body: Sky over several cities in US' states of South Dakota, Nebraska and Iowa turned green following a powerful storm. The US' National Weather Service (NWS) said the storm was a derecho. It brought powerful winds, with speeds of around 159 kmph in some areas. "Have never seen something like that," a Twitter user wrote sharing a picture of green sky.

229.title: Twitter removes director Leena's Kaali poster tweet showing goddess smoking; she responds
229.article_body: Twitter has removed filmmaker Leena Manimekalai's 'Kaali' movie poster tweet which showed the goddess smoking. Manimekalai tweeted, "This is hilarious. Will Twitter India withhold the tweets of the 200000 hate mongers?! These lowlife trolls tweeted and spread the very same poster that they find objectionable." She added Kaali is the goddess of death and cannot be lynched, raped or destroyed.

230.title: Woman, 3 lawyers extort money after lodging fake rape case in Agra, arrested
230.article_body: Agra Police in UP arrested a woman and three lawyers allegedly involved in extorting money by lodging a fake rape case against a man. The woman alleged that she was raped by the man at a hotel. "The woman complainant and three lawyers were arrested along with cash of ₹3.75 lakh," an official said.

231.title: Over 90 ill due to diarrhoea outbreak in Lucknow
231.article_body: More than 90 people have fallen ill after a diarrhoea outbreak in Lucknow's Aliganj allegedly due to contaminated water supply in the area. While eight people have been admitted to hospital due to nausea and loose motions, a one-year-old child reportedly died due to the disease. "We took samples of...water...prima facie it appears to be contaminated," a medical officer said.

232.title: Level 2 fire breaks out in Mumbai supermarket, 12 fire tenders rushed
232.article_body: A level two fire broke out in Haiko Supermarket in Hiranandani Powai area of Mumbai. News agency ANI reported that 12 fire tenders were rushed to the spot. Reports also said that no one has been reported trapped in the building so far. No injuries or casualties have been reported.

233.title: Policeman removed from post over objectionable comments against UP CM
233.article_body: A station house officer (SHO) of Asandra Police Station in Uttar Pradesh's Barabanki has been removed from his post for allegedly making objectionable comments against CM Yogi Adityanath. BJP district president Shashank Kushumesh received a video from a journalist wherein the SHO was purportedly making comments against CM Yogi while talking to someone in his office room.

234.title: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann gets married to Dr Gurpreet Kaur, first pic surfaces
234.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Thursday got married to Dr Gurpreet Kaur in a private ceremony, which was also attended by Delhi CM and AAP Convenor Arvind Kejriwal. Mann was earlier married to Inderpreet Kaur, with whom he got divorced in 2015. He has two children from his first marriage.

235.title: Islamic State claims responsibility for prison attack in Nigeria
235.article_body: Islamic State militant group has claimed responsibility for attacking a prison in Nigeria's capital Abuja on Tuesday. A total of 879 inmates had fled following the attack. Around 443 are still at large and the rest have been recaptured, the prison service said. Nigeria's President Muhammadu Buhari has questioned the prison's intelligence system and demanded a report on the attack.

236.title: CAs who helped Chinese nationals establish Vivo-linked firm under probe: Report
236.article_body: Indian agencies are now probing the local support that two Chinese nationals got in establishing a company which projected itself as a subsidiary of Vivo, The Economic Times reported citing sources. Two chartered accountants and a company secretary are under probe in the matter. Forged documents, certified by the three, were allegedly used to register Grand Prospect International Communication.

237.title: 12-year-old girl sexually harassed in Gurugram, accused arrested
237.article_body: A 24-year-old man was arrested in Gurugram for allegedly sexually harassing a 12-year-old girl. "Earlier, I took the matter to the panchayat where Sanjay (accused) was asked [not to do] such a thing again," the victim's father said. However, the accused harassed the girl again on Tuesday, her father claimed, following which he filed a complaint with the police.

238.title: Other Muslims are Assamese too: Assam CM on indigenous status to 5 Muslim communities
238.article_body: After Assam cabinet granted indigenous status to five Assamese-speaking Muslim communities, Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said other Muslims are Assamese too and shouldn't worry. "They are Goria, Moriya, Deshi, Julah and Syed," state Health Minister Keshab Mahanta said earlier. This will ensure their development in health, education, skill development and women empowerment, Sarma said.

239.title: Over 44,000 challans issued under bus lane enforcement drive in Delhi
239.article_body: Delhi government's transport department has challaned a total of 44,594 people over the last two months under its bus lane enforcement drive. According to the department, till July 4, 1,591 bus drivers were challaned for lane violations, whereas 43,003 challans were issued to private vehicle owners for parking in bus lanes. The drive was launched on April 1 this year.

240.title: Man slits woman's throat for refusing sexual advances in Delhi
240.article_body: A 25-year-old man was arrested after he allegedly slit a 22-year-old woman's throat for refusing his sexual advances in Delhi's Gandhi Nagar area, police said. "Her 'mangal sutra' was found sunk on her throat and blood was oozing from there," police added. The accused, identified as Maan Singh, is a resident of Uttar Pradesh's Kaushambi, police stated.

241.title: UK jeweller paid $7.5 mn ransom in Bitcoin to Russian hackers: Report
241.article_body: Luxury British jeweller Graff Diamonds paid $7.5 million ransom in Bitcoin to a group of Russian hackers after it leaked some of its customers' data and threatened to leak more, Bloomberg reported. Graff has now sued its insurance firm, alleging it has denied to pay for the losses incurred due to the extortion. The data leak happened in September 2021.

242.title: England are desperate for pacer who can bowl 95 mph like Umran: Gough
242.article_body: Former England pacer Darren Gough said England are desperate for a pacer who can bowl at a speed of 95 mph like India's Umran Malik. Gough added that Malik should be picked by India in their lineups for the upcoming T20I series against England. "We've got Mark Wood who is injured...we've got Archer who is [also] injured," stated Gough.

243.title: I attempted suicide when I was 21 or 22, jumped in Ganga river: Kailash Kher
243.article_body: Singer Kailash Kher revealed he attempted suicide when he was 21 or 22. "I felt I was useless to the world and not supposed to be born in this time and [plastic] world," he said. Kailash added, "I jumped in the Ganga river...someone saved me...At the time I thought I must be such a useless man...I even failed in this."

244.title: Actress Bevin Prince's husband William Friend dies at 33 after being struck by lightning
244.article_body: Actress Bevin Prince's husband William Friend passed away aged 33 after being struck by lightning on a boat near Masonboro Island in North Carolina in the US. Emergency responders tried to resuscitate him, but he was pronounced dead in the ambulance. William was the CEO of multi-platform digital media company Bisnow.

245.title: Zomato responds after pic shows price difference between Zomato online & offline bills
245.article_body: Zomato has responded after a LinkedIn user made a comparison of Zomato online and offline food bills of the same order. Zomato responded to the user saying it has no control over the prices set by its partner restaurants. "That said, we have conveyed your feedback to the restaurant partner and have requested them to look into this," Zomato added.

246.title: Not a bad option at all: Gavaskar on Pant as opener in white-ball cricket
246.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar has said Team India wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant can be "equally destructive" as an opener in white-ball cricket. "Not a bad option at all...[as opener] Pant will have a few deliveries to get used to the pace and movement...That can actually work in India's favour," explained Gavaskar. Pant scored a century and a fifty in Edgbaston Test.

247.title: Kejriwal wishes Mann on his marriage, says he is embarking on new journey
247.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal reached Punjab's Mohali on Thursday morning to take part in Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann's wedding ceremony and congratulated Mann for his "new journey". "He is embarking on a new journey today, I wish him a happy married life," Kejriwal said. Mann will get married to Dr Gurpreet Kaur in a private ceremony in Chandigarh.

248.title: TMC's Mahua posts 'Be careful, Mahua!' poem by citizen after FIR over Goddess Kali remark
248.article_body: TMC MP Mahua Moitra took to Twitter to share a poem 'Be careful, Mahua!' reportedly written for her by a citizen of India after FIRs were filed against her in West Bengal and Madhya Pradesh over her remarks on Goddess Kali. Moitra had said that Goddess Kali ate meat and accepted alcohol. TMC had condemned Moitra's remarks.

249.title: Sanjay said 'Tell me what to do', told me 'show me how to do scene': Karan
249.article_body: 'Shamshera' director Karan Malhotra, while speaking about working with actor Sanjay Dutt again, said that he came to the set and said, "Tell me what to do." "I told him this is what scene is...Then he'd ask me, 'Show me how to do it once'. I would play whole part...and he would look at me with childlike excitement," he added.

250.title: Decomposed body of man found in apartment of Thane's housing society
250.article_body: The decomposed body of a 47-year-old man was found inside an apartment in a Thane-based housing society, the police said. The incident came to light after the neighbour of the man complained to local firemen about foul smell from the house. The firemen rushed to the spot and found the decomposed body of the man, Satishkumar Krishna Pillai, lying inside.

251.title: Chemist arrested for illegal sale of abortion kits in Gurugram
251.article_body: A chemist was arrested in Gurugram's Sohna on Tuesday for allegedly selling medical kits for abortion illegally. According to police, the accused identified as Nafiz was caught with five medical termination of pregnancy (MTP) kits. He would sell them without a bill and prescription. These kits were allegedly used to abort the female foetus in the region, police said.

252.title: LazyPay temporarily suspends 'Buy Now, Pay Later' service after RBI directive
252.article_body: PayU-owned startup LazyPay has temporarily suspended its 'Buy Now, Pay Later (BNPL)' service named LazyPlus UPI. The suspension comes a month after RBI stated that non-bank wallets and pre-paid cards cannot extend credit lines via their products to customers. Through LazyPlus UPI, which was launched in 2020, the startup was offering a credit line of up to ₹1 lakh.

253.title: Hate cannot be countered through hate: Jamiat chief Mahmood Madani
253.article_body: Speaking about incidents of violence in the country following row over remarks against Prophet Muhammad, Muslim organisation Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind's chief Maulana Mahmood Asad Madani said that hate cannot be countered through hate. "The circumstances prevailing in the country, if it continues like this, then the loss will be of the country, not of any particular religion or community," he added.

254.title: Hyd civic body deploys 2,375 staffers to contain vector-borne diseases
254.article_body: In order to tackle the spread of vector-borne diseases, Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) has decided to deploy 2,375 of its staff members. GHMC has also allotted two portable fogging machines to every ward and two vehicle-mounted fogging machines to every circle. Notably, anti-larval operations are being carried out with 642 teams on a weekly basis in Hyderabad.

255.title: BMC to build 100 artificial lakes for Ganesh visarjan in Mumbai: Report
255.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) is reportedly planning to build 100 artificial lakes across Mumbai for Ganesh visarjan. Officials of all 24 administrative wards have been asked to make arrangements for three to four lakes in each ward, reports added. This comes after BMC ordered citizens to immerse Ganesh idols made of Plaster of Paris (PoP) only in artificial lakes.

256.title: US July 4 parade gunman considered carrying out 2nd attack: Police
256.article_body: The 21-year-old man accused of opening fire on a US Independence Day parade and killing seven people admitted he considered attacking another July 4 event while on the run, police said. Indications are that Robert Crimo didn't carry out the attack because "he hadn't put enough...research into it", they added. Reportedly, he'd approximately 60 rounds of ammunition in his car.

257.title: Time will tell whether Edgbaston Test defeat will affect T20Is, ODIs: Rohit
257.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma, on being asked whether the Edgbaston Test defeat will have any impact on the white-ball series against England, said, "It's a different format and a different set of players who are going to take the field for us." He added, "England [are] also a different side...time will tell whether that result has impacted our preparation."

258.title: The manner in which India lost the 5th Test has to be a shock: Agarkar
258.article_body: Ajit Agarkar said England's win by seven wickets having been handed a 378-run target in the fifth Test against India, has to be a "shock" for the latter. Agarkar added India certainly had to make England work harder, adding they chased down the target quite easily. Both teams will face off in the first T20I of their three-match series today.

259.title: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann's pic in his wedding attire shared by Raghav Chadha
259.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann's picture in his wedding attire was shared by AAP leader Raghav Chadha on Twitter. Earlier, Chadha had said, "Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal will be arriving shortly with his family. I have come here with my mother. I wholeheartedly congratulate Bhagwant Mann and his family." Mann will tie the knot with Dr Gurpreet Kaur today.

260.title: Govt releases 2nd list of 23 beneficiaries under PLI scheme for drones
260.article_body: The government has released the second provisional list of 23 beneficiaries under the PLI Scheme of Drones and Drone Components. This list included Adani-Elbit, Garuda Aerospace, Throttle Aerospace Systems and Absolute Composites, among others. The combined annual sales turnover of the listed companies has increased from ₹88 crore in FY 2020-21 to ₹319 crore (unaudited) in FY 2021-22.

261.title: FIR against AAP MLA for assaulting 2 men over sewage complaint
261.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) MLA Akhilesh Pati Tripathi was booked for allegedly assaulting two men in Delhi's Ashok Vihar area. One of the victims, Guddu Halwai, claimed that he met the AAP lawmaker during a function and complained about sewage problems in the area which angered the MLA who reportedly hit him on his head with a piece of brick.

262.title: Journalist says Raghav was thought as most eligible AAP bachelor, he replies
262.article_body: After a journalist tweeted that people thought Raghav Chadha was the most eligible bachelor in AAP ahead of Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann's wedding, Chadha responded, saying, "The turn of the younger ones comes only after the elder." Chadha also wrote, "Best wishes to my vadde veer Mann Saab and Dr Gurpreet Kaur for a happy and blessed married life."

263.title: Idea of punishing a nuclear power like us poses threat to existence of humanity: Russia
263.article_body: The Deputy Chairman of the Russian Security Council, Dmitry Medvedev, has commented on attempts by the West to punish Russia for the war in Ukraine. Medvedev said, "The idea of punishing a country that has one of the largest nuclear potentials is absurd. And potentially poses a threat to the existence of humanity."

264.title: Jordanian Princess Iman gets engaged to New York-based financier Thermiotis, pic surfaces
264.article_body: Jordanian Princess Iman bint Abdullah II got engaged to New York-based financier Jameel Alexander Thermiotis on Tuesday. Princess Iman, who is 25 years old, is the eldest daughter of Queen Rania and King Abdullah II of Jordan. Meanwhile, Thermiotis was born in Venezuela's Caracas in 1994 and is of Greek descent.

265.title: Everything I tweet is my personal opinion, I don't have any other kind: Tharoor
265.article_body: Congress' Shashi Tharoor said everything he tweets is his personal opinion. "I don't have any other kind," he tweeted. This comes after he said he was taken aback by "attack" on TMC's Mahua Moitra over her remark on goddess Kaali. Meanwhile, Congress' Ragini Nayak said, "Shashi Tharoorji expresses his personal opinions assertively and has done same on this issue too."

266.title: FIR against those sacrificing cattle for Bakri Eid: K'taka Minister
266.article_body: Karnataka Animal Husbandry Minister Prabhu Bhamla Chavan has urged people to not slaughter cattle for Bakri Eid  and warned stern action against offenders. "If cow slaughter is found, an FIR will be registered in the local police station...and strict action will be taken against the culprits," Chavan said. A task force has been appointed in Bengaluru to prevent cow slaughter.

267.title: Samsung Electronics forecasts highest Q2 operating profit since 2018
267.article_body: Samsung Electronics posted its preliminary earnings report for the second quarter on Thursday, forecasting highest Q2 operating profit since 2018. The South Korea-based company's profit in Q2 rose to around $10.73 billion, up from around $9.63 billion in the same quarter last year, as per estimates. Its sales rose to around $59.14 billion, the report estimated.

268.title: Pune man promised dating membership with 'sexual services', loses ₹18 lakh
268.article_body: A man, who was contacted by a woman, under pretext of offering him a "dating membership", which she claimed provided "sexual services by women", lost ₹18 lakh after he agreed to be a member. The woman allegedly asked the man to pay money for various purposes and also threatened to lodge a criminal case against him.

269.title: Red alert issued for several Maha areas amid heavy rains; Mumbai on orange alert
269.article_body: Amid heavy rains lashing Maharashtra, the India Meteorological Department has issued a red alert for Raigad, Ratnagiri, Kolhapur and Sindhudurg till July 9. Apart from that, Palghar, Pune and Satara are on red alert till July 8. News agency ANI reported that Mumbai and Thane are on orange alert till July 10.

270.title: I want us to play in same fashion, to be really aggressive: Buttler
270.article_body: England's newly appointed white-ball captain Jos Buttler has said their recent success in Test cricket is a reminder of the way they want to play cricket as well. "I want us to play in exactly the same fashion...really aggressive and not afraid of failure," he added. England will play three T20Is and as many ODIs against India.

271.title: Govt sets up panel to suggest testing SOPs for EV batteries: Report
271.article_body: The government has formed a panel which will formulate an SOP for testing and validation of key components and formulate a certification standard for EV batteries, The Indian Express reported citing an official. "The committee will suggest ways to ensure the right quality of the product," the official added. This comes amid several EV fires reported in the country.

272.title: 3 killed in landslide in K'taka; schools, colleges closed in 4 districts amid heavy rains
272.article_body: At least three persons were killed and one was severely injured in a landslide in Karnataka's Dakshina Kannada amid heavy rains, police said. Following a red alert issued by IMD, authorities announced that Anganwadi schools and colleges will remain closed on Thursday in Udupi, Kodagu, Uttara Kannada and Hassan. Tourists and fishermen have been advised not to go to beaches.

273.title: Initially, Deepika's parents were completely thrown off by me: Ranveer
273.article_body: Ranveer Singh said his wife, actress Deepika Padukone's parents were initially "completely thrown off" by him. "Who's this, what's this? Especially Deepika's mom. She [didn't] know what to make of me," added Ranveer. "I have two wardrobes...When I go to Bangalore, there's a special wardrobe- white T-shirt and blue jeans. I don't want to throw (my in-laws) off," he stated.

274.title: Faridkot DSP arrested for accepting ₹10 lakh bribe from drugs supplier
274.article_body: Punjab Police arrested Faridkot Deputy Superintendent of Police (DSP), Lakhbir Singh, for allegedly accepting a ₹10 lakh bribe from a drugs supplier for not naming him in the FIR. This comes after the supplier was arrested in Tarn Taran with 250 grams of opium and ₹1 lakh in cash. He was already wanted in an FIR from June, police said.

275.title: 9 new cases of BA.4, BA.5 detected in Maharashtra, all from Pune
275.article_body: Maharashtra has detected nine new cases of BA.5 and BA.4 sub-variants of Omicron strain of COVID-19, bringing the overall tally of BA.4 and BA.5 patients in the state to 73, the state health department said. All six patients of BA.5 and three of BA.4 were from Pune, it added. The city also reported 10 new cases of Omicron's BA.2.75 sub-variant.

276.title: 17-yr-old tries to loot jewellery shop taking advantage of heavy rain in Mumbai
276.article_body: A 17-year-old boy tried to loot a Vasai-based jewellery shop by climbing over the asbestos sheet of the shop amid heavy rain in Mumbai. Hearing the noise inside the shop, people gathered and thrashed the accused thief and later informed the shop owner. Taking advantage of the torrential downpour the thief made the attempt, Sub-Inspector Atul Nawale said.

277.title: HomeTown announces 'Mano Ya Na Mano’ sale with up to 50% off
277.article_body: HomeTown announced the 'Mano Ya Na Mano' sale with up to 50% off and 10% moneyback* on purchasing furniture, homeware and home interiors. You can take home leather recliner sofa sets, complete bedroom packages, homeware and much more at shockingly good deals, HomeTown said, adding that SBI Card holders will get extra 5% cashback*. Moneyback is valid till July 14.

278.title: Religious conversion of Hindus stopped: Goa CM on completing 100 days in office
278.article_body: Goa CM Pramod Sawant on Wednesday said religious conversions of Hindus in the state stopped within 100 days of his government assuming office. "Our government has taken a tough stance on religious conversion...Religious conversions happening for years have been stopped," he added. Furthermore, he said, "We formed SIT to look into illegal land acquisition matter."

279.title: Dhoni attends Nadal's Wimbledon match, celebrates birthday in London; pics surface
279.article_body: Former Team India captain MS Dhoni attended Rafael Nadal's quarter-final match at Wimbledon in London on Wednesday. He then went on to celebrate his 41st birthday in London. Pictures from his birthday celebration have surfaced online. Team India wicketkeeper Rishabh Pant was also seen in attendance during Dhoni's birthday celebrations.

280.title: Dad's cooler, fitter than me: Hrithik on dad Rakesh Roshan's workout video
280.article_body: Actor Hrithik Roshan took to Instagram to share a video clip of his father Rakesh Roshan working out. "Goals!" the actor wrote. He also used hashtags that said that his dad is cooler and fitter than him. Several celebrities including Farhan Akhtar, Priyank Sharma and Kunal Kapoor reacted to Hrithik's post.

281.title: I struggled initially, but recovery from COVID-19 has been good: Rohit
281.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma, who had missed the Edgbaston Test after testing positive for COVID-19, has said his recovery from the virus has been good and he's feeling nice and healthy. "I resumed training three days ago, and decided to play [first T20I against England]," stated Rohit. "There are no symptoms [now]. I've tested negative two-three times," he added.

282.title: Supporting DOGE wherever possible: Musk on Boring Company accepting DOGE
282.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk, in response to a report saying his firm The Boring Company will accept Dogecoin as payment for rides on its Las Vegas transit system 'Loop', said, "Supporting DOGE wherever possible." Rides are currently free on Loop but the firm reportedly plans to charge eventually. Single rides will cost $1.50, while day passes will cost $2.50.

283.title: Kamal Nath threatened police, administration during his term: MP CM
283.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Wednesday said former CM Kamal Nath used to threaten police and administration during his term and continues to do so. "They've understood that Congress...lost badly and...the defeat has to be blamed on someone," Chouhan added. His comments came after Kamal Nath accused BJP of using police, money and administration for civic polls.

284.title: Moon brought humans together in 1969, Mars can do that in future: Musk
284.article_body: Tesla and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk took to Twitter to say, "Moon brought us [humans] together in 1969, Mars can do that in the future." He also said humanity will "fight itself" without a common goal. "Humanity will reach Mars in your lifetime," he added. Responding to his tweets a Twitter user said, "I don't believe in the moon landing."

285.title: India reports 18,930 new COVID-19 cases, 35 deaths; active cases rise to 1,19,457
285.article_body: India has reported 18,930 COVID-19 cases, 14,650 recoveries and 35 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 16,159 cases and 28 deaths. Notably, India's active COVID-19 cases jumped to 1,19,457, while the death toll reached 5,25,305.

286.title: What is Apple's new 'Lockdown Mode' for its devices?
286.article_body: Apple's new "Lockdown Mode", which will be coming this fall with iOS 16, iPadOS 16, and macOS Ventura, is an "extreme, optional protection for users who face grave, targeted threats to their digital security". "It will help protect users who may be personally targeted by some of the most sophisticated digital threats, such as...state-sponsored mercenary spyware," Apple said.

287.title: Nobody imagined 'Tu Cheez...' will change everything for Akshay: Boxwala
287.article_body: Producer Shabbir Boxwala said nobody had imagined in their "wildest dreams" that the song 'Tu Cheez Badi Hai Mast' from 1994 film 'Mohra' will change everything for Akshay Kumar. Boxwala, who was the film's production designer, said, "We offered Mohra to Sridevi...However, we didn't have big male stars. Akshay and Suniel [weren't] known...Any heroine would think twice before saying yes."

288.title: Mentally challenged man climbs electric tower in Mumbai; rescued
288.article_body: A 35-year-old mentally challenged man was rescued after he climbed an electric tower near Kasara railway station in Mumbai twice on Wednesday. "He was merely smiling and waving and didn't speak a word...We offered him tea...biscuits and tried to convince him to come down," one of the rescuers said. "The tower is near a high-tension wire," an officer said.

289.title: IAS officer who got 44.8% in Class 10 shares his marksheet
289.article_body: IAS Awanish Sharan, who scored 44.8% in Class 10, has shared his marksheet on Twitter. Reacting to his post, a Twitter user wrote, "I left preparation thinking that UPSC considers only toppers. But you changed my perception today." "You have no idea sir how much you motivate youths like me that nothing is impossible," another user tweeted.

290.title: File your FIRs, will see you in every court in land: Mahua on her remark
290.article_body: Following her remark on goddess Kaali, TMC's Mahua Moitra said, "I do not want to live in an India where BJP's monolithic, patriarchal [and] brahminical view of Hinduism will prevail and rest of us will tiptoe around religion." Furthermore, she tweeted, "I'll defend this till I die. File your FIRs - will see you in every court in land."

291.title: Did backflip, SRK's car stopped in lobby, he said 'You were good': Vidyut
291.article_body: Actor Vidyut Jammwal said that he once did a backflip on ramp during his modelling days. "Shah Rukh sir was in attendance. After the fashion show, we models were waiting in the lobby. And there is this fancy car that comes with silver glasses...car stopped...window goes down and he [Shah Rukh Khan] says, 'Vidyut, you were good'," he added.

292.title: Nadal registers 5-set win over Fritz, reaches his 8th Wimbledon semi-final
292.article_body: Rafael Nadal defeated Taylor Fritz to reach the Wimbledon semi-finals for the eighth time. Nadal lost the first set and took a medical time-out in the second but won the match 3-6, 7-5, 3-6, 7-5, 7-6 (10-4) in four hours and 21 minutes. He will now face Nick Kyrgios, who has reached a Grand Slam semi-final for the first time.

293.title: B'luru ranked 146th on Global Liveability Index, least among Indian cities
293.article_body: Bengaluru has been ranked 146th on the Global Liveability Index 2022 which was released recently by the Economist Intelligence Unit (EIU). The EIU ranked 173 cities across the world which included five Indian cities - Delhi, Mumbai, Chennai, Ahmedabad, and Bengaluru. Bengaluru scored the least out of the five Indian cities with a score of 54.4 out of 100.

294.title: IMD predicts light to moderate rainfall in Hyderabad on Thursday
294.article_body: Hyderabad will witness light to moderate rainfall on Thursday, India Meteorological Department (IMD) predicted. Telangana will likely witness heavy to very heavy rainfall in the next few days, it added. "The districts in southern Telangana are expected to receive heavy to very heavy rainfall...central parts can also experience good rainfall in the next five days," an IMD scientist said.

295.title: I am 'really upset' about my prop status as an actor: Karan Johar
295.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar said he's "really upset" about his "prop status" as an actor, having not been offered any role after Ranbir Kapoor-starrer 'Bombay Velvet'. "If given an opportunity...I might be good," added Karan. Discussing the worst criticism for his hosting skills, Karan stated that he received it from Jaya Bachchan who said he speaks "too loudly" on the stage.

296.title: FTX has "a few billion" to help struggling crypto firms: Billionaire CEO
296.article_body: Cryptocurrency exchange FTX's billionaire CEO Sam Bankman-Fried has said the platform still has "a few billion" on hand to support struggling firms that could further destabilise the crypto industry. "We're starting to get a few more companies reaching out to us," Bankman-Fried said. His firms have recently helped platforms like crypto lenders Voyager Digital and BlockFi.

297.title: Pune 6-yr-old out with mom to get vehicle washed dies as grinder falls on him
297.article_body: A 6-year-old boy died after a grinder machine fell on his head at a workshop when he was out with his mother to get their vehicle washed in Pune. "We have not taken...statement of family members, once they register the FIR we will take further steps," police said. Reports said he was rushed to the hospital but was declared dead.

298.title: 4 held for stealing cash & jewellery worth ₹3 cr from shop in B'luru
298.article_body: Four people from Rajasthan's Chittorgarh were arrested on Wednesday for allegedly stealing cash and jewellery worth around ₹3 crore from a showroom in Bengaluru. "The accused had robbed Ramdev Bankers and Jewellers showroom...at gunpoint," Udaipur SP Vikas Sharma said, adding, "The accused were...handed over to Bengaluru police.'' The robbed items were recovered from accused after a police chase.

299.title: 12 buildings in Kurla to be torn down to avoid collapses: BMC
299.article_body: BMC has decided to bring down all dilapidated buildings in Kurla to avert collapses. Accordingly, it has identified 12 such private buildings categorised as C-1 structures, meaning they are dangerous to inhabit and started issuing notices to occupants to vacate them at the earliest. The decision came after a four-storeyed residential building in Kurla collapsed last week, killing 19 people.

300.title: Lady constable helps woman deliver baby at railway station in Thane
300.article_body: A lady constable of Railway Protection Force (RPF) helped a 30-year-old woman from Thane's Titwala deliver a baby girl at Diva railway station on Wednesday morning. The woman had reportedly fainted at the station following which lady constable Mamta Dangi helped her to a safer spot. Dangi then created a makeshift cloth curtain to help the woman with her delivery.

301.title: 3 stabbed in Karnataka's Kerur, large gatherings banned till Friday
301.article_body: At least three people were stabbed in clashes that broke out between members of two groups on Wednesday in Kerur in Karnataka's Bagalkote. This comes after members of each side accused the other of harassing women. Large gatherings have been banned till Friday as a precautionary measure, police said. Schools and colleges will remain closed on Thursday, police added.

302.title: IAS officer shares pic of MS Dhoni, says 'Why Dhoni is loved'
302.article_body: IAS officer Awanish Sharan took to Twitter on Wednesday to share a picture of former Team India captain MS Dhoni and wrote, "Why Dhoni is loved." In the picture, MS Dhoni can be seen taking a selfie with two female fans. "Dhoni is real inspiration," a fan commented. Dhoni on Thursday turned 41 years old.

303.title: Professor in Bihar returns 33-month salary of ₹24 lakh over students not attending classes
303.article_body: Lallan Kumar, an assistant professor at Nitishwar College in Bihar’s Muzaffarpur, returned his 33-month salary of ₹24 lakh due to students not attending classes. "My conscience doesn't allow...If I take a salary without teaching...it'd be academic death for me," he said. "It's not just absenteeism...but...pressure tactic to get a transfer to postgraduate department," principal Manoj Kumar said.

304.title: FBI, MI5 chiefs warn of threat from China at rare joint address in London
304.article_body: The US' FBI Director Christopher Wray and the UK's MI5 Director General Ken McCallum have cautioned business leaders against threat from the Chinese government, in an unprecedented joint address in London. "We consistently see that it's the Chinese government that poses the biggest long-term threat to our economic and national security...along with our allies in Europe and elsewhere," Wray said.

305.title: Jaya said 'You have a mic, why are you shouting': Karan on hosting criticism
305.article_body: While talking about criticism he has received for his hosting skills, filmmaker Karan Johar said actress Jaya Bachchan asked him why was he shouting when he had mic. "I was like, 'I am trying to be energetic'. She said, 'You have a mic and that's what it is for, you don't need to scream when you are speaking'," he added.

306.title: Elon Musk welcomed twins with one of his top executives last year: Report
306.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk welcomed twins with Shivon Zilis, a top executive at his brain-chip startup Neuralink, in November of 2021, Business Insider reported on Wednesday. In April, Musk and Zilis reportedly filed a petition to change the name of the twins to "have their father's last name" and contain their mother's last name as part of their middle name.

307.title: Who is 1993-born Dr Gurpreet Kaur, Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann's bride?
307.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann's bride Dr Gurpreet Kaur was born in 1993 and she hails from a village in Pehowa area of Haryana's Kurukshetra district. She completed her MBBS with a gold medal from Maharishi Markandeshwar University at Mullana in Haryana in 2018. Her father is a farmer, while her mother is a homemaker. She has two elder sisters.

308.title: 25 MCD schools to be upgraded as pilot project: Delhi LG
308.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena has said that 25 Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) schools will be upgraded as a pilot project in order to improve teaching, technology and physical infrastructure in civic body-run schools. "Work will be started there at the earliest. The same would gradually be undertaken in all other remaining schools run by MCD," Saxena added.

309.title: Microsoft's $68.7 bn Activision deal faces competition probe in UK
309.article_body: The UK's competition watchdog CMA has opened a probe into Microsoft's $68.7 billion deal to acquire 'Call of Duty' maker Activision Blizzard. The CMA has set a deadline of September 1 for its initial decision. It'll assess whether the deal would reduce competition. Microsoft has said it's "appropriate for regulators to take a close look at this acquisition".

310.title: Pune to have no cuts in water supply between July 8 and 11
310.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) will restore normal water supply to the city's residents from July 8 to July 11 on account of Ashadi Ekadashi and Bakri Eid celebrations on Sunday. PMC will take further decisions on water management after reviewing the situation on July 11. PMC had adopted a 30% water cut by announcing water supply on alternate days.

311.title: Netanyahu received gifts from billionaire: Witness in corruption trial
311.article_body: Ex-Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu had received gifts of champagne, cigars and jewellery from billionaire Arnon Milchan, according to a witness in the corruption trial against Netanyahu. The trial is addressing allegations that while in office, Netanyahu had accepted gifts worth hundreds of thousands of dollars from Milchan and billionaire James Packer. Netanyahu is facing two more corruption cases.

312.title: You have to go 'all in' to be a successful entrepreneur: Anupam Mittal
312.article_body: Shark Tank India judge Anupam Mittal shared a clip on LinkedIn from an interview about his journey as an entrepreneur. Alongside, he wrote, "Money managers think the way to create wealth is to spread your risk...but ask any successful entrepreneur...you'll find that they've gone 'all in'." He added, "Ultimately...it depends on...how much risk allows you to sleep well at night."

313.title: MyGlamm parent The Good Glamm Group to open international division
313.article_body: Beauty firm MyGlamm's parent company The Good Glamm Group has decided to open an international division, as per a statement. The group further said it will consolidate its group companies into independent divisions- brands, media and creators. Last year, The Good Glamm Group acquired content brands such as ScoopWhoop, Miss Malini, The Moms Co among others.

314.title: Google launches Startup School India to enable 10,000 startups
314.article_body: Google India has launched Startup School to enable 10,000 startups in tier II and III cities across the country. With this programme, they aim to provide startup owners with resources and information to expand their business through guided online training. The virtual programme will offer fireside conversations with Google leaders and partners in the startup ecosystem.

315.title: Oil prices drop to 12-week low amid recession, COVID-19 fears
315.article_body: Oil prices on Wednesday dropped to a 12-week low amid fears of a possible global recession and demand cut in China amid new COVID-19 lockdowns. While Brent futures for September delivery fell 2.9% to $99.78 a barrel, US West Texas Intermediate (WTI) crude fell 3.2% to $96.31. This comes a day after Brent fell 9% and WTI fell 8%.

316.title: Vivo Directors escape from India amid ED inquiry against the Chinese firm: Report
316.article_body: Vivo Directors Zhengshen Ou and Zhang Jie have escaped from India as Enforcement Directorate (ED) intensified inquiry into the money laundering case against the Chinese smartphone manufacturing company, said ANI quoting sources. ED on Tuesday conducted raids at 44 locations of Vivo and related firms. The raids were conducted under sections of the Prevention of Money Laundering Act.

317.title: Jalandhar Police seize 536 passports in illegal immigration racket
317.article_body: The Jalandhar City Police have busted an illegal immigration racket and seized 536 Indian passports. They have arrested four people who were running five unauthorised consultancies and cheated people with promises of sending them abroad. The police also seized cash worth ₹49,000, a laptop and three computers from the possession of the suspects, who are all from Ludhiana.

318.title: US Independence Day parade shooter confesses to carrying out attack
318.article_body: The man charged with killing seven people at an Independence Day parade in the US confessed to the police that he had carried out the mass shooting from a rooftop in suburban Chicago, authorities said. Crimo had appeared in court via a video link on Wednesday. Separately, a police spokesman said that Crimo had "seriously contemplated" carrying out another attack.

319.title: Reduce prices by up to ₹10 within a week: Govt to edible oil firms
319.article_body: The government has directed edible oil manufacturers to cut the MRP of imported cooking oils by up to ₹10 per litre within a week. "Global prices have declined 10% in last one week...This should be passed on to consumers," the government said. It also asked the companies to maintain a uniform MRP of the same brand of oil throughout India.

320.title: Comedian Samay Raina criticised after he tweets joke on abortion
320.article_body: Comedian and YouTuber Samay Raina was criticised after he shared a joke on abortion. "It really takes guts to call yourself a comedian when this is your understanding of...humour," a Twitter user commented. "Even by dark humour standards, this is...crass!" another comment read. "Abortion is not a joke to the ones who [are] going through it," another person commented.

321.title: Nick Kyrgios reaches semi-final of a Grand Slam for the first time ever
321.article_body: World number 40 Nick Kyrgios defeated Cristian Garin in the quarter-final to reach Wimbledon 2022 semi-final. With this, the 27-year-old reached the semi-final of a Grand Slam for the first time. Kyrgios won the quarter-final with a scoreline of 6-4, 6-3, 7-6(7-5). Kyrgios is the first Australian man to reach the singles semi-final at Wimbledon since Lleyton Hewitt in 2005.

322.title: Piyush Goyal urges states to increase sowing of rice
322.article_body: Food Minister Piyush Goyal has urged all states to increase sowing of paddy, saying this season "sowing of rice is 16% lower than the normal level nationally". He clarified there is enough rice stock with the government. However, there is huge demand for rice internationally and the farmers must use this opportunity to export, the minister said.

323.title: S African prez mourns death of teenagers in East London nightclub
323.article_body: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa on Wednesday mourned the death of 21 teenagers in a nightclub in East London last month. The cause of the deaths is still being investigated. In a public funeral attended by over a thousand people, the president said, "We are losing our future generation to the scourge of underage drinking."

324.title: Rhea's career is ruined for no fault of her, she's not getting roles: Rana
324.article_body: Bengali film producer Rana Sarkar said that actress Rhea Chakraborty's career is being jeopardised for no fault of her. "She went through a lot of trouble and she is also not getting roles in Mumbai," he added. "She has been haunted for being someone’s girlfriend and for being Bengali. I genuinely think she deserves better," he said.

325.title: Fake call centre busted in Kolkata; 10 arrested
325.article_body: Kolkata police have busted a fake call centre in the city's Rajarhat sector, arresting 10 people and seizing incriminating electronic material and documents from them. The accused would cheat people living in foreign countries on the pretext of offering technical support in exchange for money. The accused were booked for fraud, cheating and criminal conspiracy.

326.title: Pune City Police arrest 5 who stole fuel from BPCL tankers
326.article_body: The Pune City Police busted a racket and arrested 5 people who stole petrol and diesel from Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited (BPCL) tankers. The police have booked five others whom they suspected were involved in the racket. The police also seized a BPCL tanker worth ₹80 lakh along with cell phones, cash, three diesel cans and motorcycles from the accused.

327.title: 900 inmates escape Nigerian prison in attack blamed on Boko Haram
327.article_body: Nearly 900 inmates escaped from a prison in Nigeria's Abuja during a suspected Boko Haram attack, officials said on Wednesday. Of these, nearly 440 inmates have been recaptured, while the rest of the inmates are still at large, according to a government spokesperson. The suspected Boko Haram attackers came for members who were held in the prison, an official said.

328.title: City Union Bank to raise up to ₹500 crore via QIP route
328.article_body: City Union Bank on Wednesday announced it is planning to raise up to ₹500 crore through the qualified institutional placement (QIP) route. The private lender added that it has called an annual general meeting (AGM) on August 18 to seek approval for the fund-raising proposal. Last year also it obtained shareholders' approval but did not utilise the same, it added.

329.title: Happy that he has resigned: KJ Alphons on Saji Cherian's resignation
329.article_body: BJP MP KJ Alphons has said that he is happy that Saji Cherian has resigned after the latter resigned from the Kerala Cabinet. "It's [a] shame that the ministers feel they can desecrate the Constitution of India," KJ Alphons said. Saji Cherian resigned on Wednesday amid protests over his remarks on the Constitution.

330.title: Reliance Retail signs long-term deal to bring Gap to India
330.article_body: Reliance Retail on Wednesday said it has signed a long-term deal with Gap Inc to sell the US clothing retailer's brands locally. Under the partnership, Reliance will sell Gap merchandise through a mix of exclusive brand stores, multi-brand outlets and e-commerce platforms. With this deal, the company has become the official retailer for Gap across all channels in India.

331.title: Ghulam Ahmad Mir resigns as Jammu and Kashmir Congress chief
331.article_body: Ghulam Ahmad Mir has resigned as the Jammu and Kashmir Pradesh Congress Committee (JKPCC) President. "It is the tradition in the Congress party that before any reshuffle, the existing office-bearers put in their papers. I have done the same," Mir said. Ghulam Ahmad Mir was the JKPCC chief for over seven years.

332.title: After Maha, BJP will now form govts in Raj, WB: Suvendu Adhikari
332.article_body: After rebel Shiv Sena leader Eknath Shinde-led new government was formed in Maharashtra, BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari said, "After Maharashtra, BJP will form governments even in Rajasthan, West Bengal and Telangana where appeasement politics is rampant." His remarks came a day after BJP Tamil Nadu chief K Annamalai said that Tamil Nadu is also waiting for a 'Shinde' to emerge.

333.title: Droupadi ji will represent a new India: Meghalaya CM
333.article_body: Extending support to NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu, Meghalaya CM Conrad Sangma said she will represent a new India. "She represents hope for every tribal, every girl and every woman and will carry with her the aspirations of small communities of India," Sangma tweeted. Droupadi Murmu, who visited Meghalaya, sought support of the lawmakers for the upcoming Presidential elections.

334.title: Extradited drug fugitive returns to Italy to serve 30-yr prison term
334.article_body: Extradited drug lord Rocco Morabito, who was reportedly Italy's second most-wanted fugitive, has returned to the country to serve a 30-year prison term. He was extradited from Brazil and will now serve his sentence for various drug offences. Morabito, who was absconding for almost 28 years, "became the king of cocaine brokers [there]," an Italian official said.

335.title: Ben Stokes doesn't give a damn what anybody else says: Nasser Hussain
335.article_body: Praising England Test skipper Ben Stokes' captaincy, former England captain Nasser Hussain said, "Stokes doesn't give a damn what anybody else says." Hussain added, "He is doing it his way, to the extent of having Stuart Broad padded up as nightwatchman. When did you last see Broad play a defensive shot?" England have won four Test matches in a row.

336.title: BJP wins 102 of 130 panchayat seats unopposed in Arunachal
336.article_body: The BJP has won unopposed 102 of 130 panchayat seats in Arunachal Pradesh where by-polls are scheduled next week, said state Panchayat Minister Bamang Felix. The Congress, National People's Party and Independents have secured another 14 seats unopposed. The by-election to the remaining seats will be held on July 12.

337.title: D2C bakery brand The Baker's Dozen raises $5 million
337.article_body: Direct-to-Consumer bakery brand The Baker's Dozen (TBD) has raised $5 million in its pre-Series A funding round. The funding was a mix of equity and debt led by Fireside Ventures. The company was founded in 2013 by Sneh Jain and his wife Aditi Handa, who is also the Head Baker. TBD has clocked sales of ₹30 crore in FY22.

338.title: Urban Company to grant ₹74 cr restricted stock unit to US employees
338.article_body: Urban Company's board has passed a resolution to grant restricted stock units (RSUs) worth ₹74 crore ($9.5 million) to its US-based employees. The company will draw 2,800 RSUs from its ESOP (employee stock ownership plan) 2015. The Gurugram-based home services marketplace, which was earlier called UrbanClap, has facilitated ESOP sales worth ₹100 crore for its 940 employees till date.

339.title: Bidi factory workers protest for higher wages in Kolkata
339.article_body: Bidi factory workers from across West Bengal protested in Kolkata on Wednesday, demanding a hike in wages, a standard pay structure and medical benefits. "They pay us only ₹116 for binding 1,000 bidis. The munshi (middleman) does nothing for us," said a worker. Centre of Indian Trade Union led the protest demonstrations.

340.title: RBI announces steps to boost forex inflows amid falling rupee
340.article_body: The RBI on Wednesday announced various measures to enhance foreign exchange inflows amid the rupee losing about 6% against the US dollar so far this year. The measures include allowing overseas investors to buy short-term corporate debt and purchase more government securities under the fully accessible route. India's forex reserves have fallen over $40 billion in the last nine months.

341.title: Hold Goa Panchayat polls in 45 days: SC upholds Bombay HC order
341.article_body: The Supreme Court upheld Bombay High Court's order which asked that a notification be issued to hold elections to 186 Panchayats in Goa within the next 45 days. The Goa government filed a plea requesting an extension till September to conduct the polls. The apex court said that it did not find a reason to interfere in the election process.

342.title: Goa govt geared up for e-auctioning of iron ore mining leases: CM
342.article_body: The Goa government is geared up to initiate the process of e-auctioning of iron ore mining leases, CM Pramod Sawant announced. Notably, mining activities had come to a halt in 2018 after the apex court had cancelled the second renewal of 88 mining leases granted in 2015. The government has initiated the process of taking over these leases, he said.

343.title: Centre releases revenue deficit grant of ₹7,183 crore to 14 states
343.article_body: The Finance Ministry on Wednesday released the fourth instalment of Post Devolution Revenue Deficit (PDRD) Grant of ₹7,183.42 crore to 14 states for the current fiscal. With this, the total amount of PDRD grants released to the states in 2022-23 stands at ₹28,733.67 crore. The states will get a total revenue deficit grant of ₹86,201 crore in FY23.

344.title: Used-car startup Kavak to invest $180 mn to expand into 4 more countries
344.article_body: Mexican used-car startup Kavak is planning to invest $180 million to expand into four more countries, namely Colombia, Chile, Peru and Turkey. Kavak offers clients used cars online and through brick-and-mortar hubs. Turkey will be its first location outside Latin America. "The expansion is something the company needs to do, but we're doing it conservatively," CEO Carlos Garcia Ottati said.

345.title: Ex-TikTok gaming head to launch blockchain games startup 'Meta0'
345.article_body: Jason Fung, the former head of TikTok's gaming unit, is set to launch a blockchain games startup called Meta0. The 34-year old said he gave up his "cushy" corporate life at TikTok to offer a "more interoperable" infrastructure option to developers of blockchain games. "Right now, [developers]...have to choose a single blockchain," he said. Fung will act as Meta0's Co-founder.

346.title: SC stays Madras HC order on AIADMK leadership issue
346.article_body: The Supreme Court has stayed the Madras High Court's order which stopped the AIADMK from passing resolutions on the party's single leadership issue. The apex court was responding to a plea filed by former Chief Minister Edappadi Palaniswami. The Supreme Court stay aids the dominant faction within the AIADMK which is pushing for Palaniswami to be the party's top leader.

347.title: I don't think Uddhav-led Sena expects us to return to them: Shinde
347.article_body: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde on Wednesday ruled out the possibility of going back to Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena. CM Shinde said, "I don't think they (Uddhav Thackeray faction) [expect] us to return to them especially after the way they are accusing us." Talking about forming government with BJP in Maharashtra, Shinde said he did not repent for his decision.
