348.title: Salesforce to offer $2 mn grant for workforce development in India
348.article_body: Salesforce has announced a $2 million local grant to 22 non-profits across India for education and workforce development. "These grants are expected to impact over 40,000 individuals in India," said Arundhati Bhattacharya, CEO and Chairperson of Salesforce India. Further, as part of another initiative, it plans to plant one million trees in India by 2030.

349.title: 90% of students at JNU are apolitical, 10% are troublemakers: VC
349.article_body: During an interview, Jawaharlal Nehru University Vice Chancellor Santishree Dhulipudi Pandit on Wednesday claimed that 90% of JNU students are apolitical and only 10% are troublemakers who think they can build their political careers at the varsity. She said that JNU isn't a place for pursuing political aspirations. "You come here to study, you come here to learn," she added.

350.title: 12 cult members charged with murder of 8-yr-old girl in Australia
350.article_body: At least 12 members of a cult were arrested and charged with the murder of an 8-year-old girl who died due to lack of medical treatment in Australia's Toowoomba. The victim, Elizabeth Rose Struhs, who was suffering from type-1 diabetes, was allegedly denied insulin access by the cult. The group believed that Elizabeth would be "healed by god", police said.

351.title: Holiday in Dakshina Kannada educational institutes tomorrow due to rains
351.article_body: The Dakshina Kannada district administration in Karnataka has declared a holiday for all educational institutions on July 7 (Thursday) in the wake of a red alert for rainfall issued in the district. The IMD said that extremely heavy rainfall is likely in Dakshina Kannada, Udupi and Uttara Kannada districts. The rainfall is likely to range above 204.5 mm.

352.title: 1 arrested for supplying poison that killed 9 of family in Sangli
352.article_body: Police have arrested a person from Talegaon Dabhade in Maharashtra for allegedly supplying poison to the prime accused in last month's murder of nine people from the same family in Sangli district. Prime accused Abbas Mohammad Bagwan and his driver Dheeraj Chandrakant Survase were arrested on June 26. Bagwan had reportedly taken a large loan from the victim family.

353.title: Salman's lawyer claims he got death threat letter saying 'enemy's friend is an enemy'
353.article_body: A lawyer representing Salman Khan in a blackbuck poaching case claimed he received a death threat letter from the Lawrence Bishnoi gang. Police have initiated investigation to ascertain authenticity of the threat letter and deployed a policeman with him for his security. The letter allegedly said the lawyer will meet Sidhu Moosewala's fate, adding an "enemy's friend is [an] enemy".

354.title: He has found joy in it: Kevin on brother Nick Jonas embracing fatherhood
354.article_body: Singer Kevin Jonas said he's happy for his younger brother, Nick Jonas who became a father recently. Speaking about Nick embracing fatherhood, Kevin told a news portal, "He has really found so much joy in it. We're just really happy for him." Nick and his wife Priyanka Chopra became parents to daughter Malti Marie Chopra Jonas in January 2022.

355.title: Not every film needs to bring numbers like RRR: 'Modern Love...' director
355.article_body: Modern Love Hyderabad director Nagesh Kukunoor said he's confident that the audience will react positively to storytelling attempts like the Modern Love series. "I...believe there is an audience for everything. That’s how I've managed to survive for 25 years," he added. "Not every film needs to bring...numbers like 'RRR'. There are big films, mid-level films and small ones," he added.

356.title: Happiest moment: Twinkle shares pic of man selling pirated versions of her books
356.article_body: Actor turned author Twinkle Khanna on Wednesday shared a picture of a man who was selling her books' pirated copies. Sharing the picture, Twinkle wrote, "How do you know a book has done well...The real acid test of being...bonafide bestseller though is when pirated versions of your books are sold at traffic lights. This was one of my happiest moments."

357.title: Rajasthan govt to appoint Kanhaiya Lal's 2 sons to state service
357.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Wednesday announced that the state Cabinet has decided to appoint the two sons of Kanhaiya Lal, who was beheaded in Udaipur last month, to state service. Gehlot said there is no other source of livelihood in the family of the deceased. He added that with this decision, the family will get financial and mental strength.

358.title: Shiv Sena nominates Rajan Vichare as its chief whip in Lok Sabha
358.article_body: The Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena has nominated Rajan Vichare as its chief whip in Lok Sabha replacing Bhavana Gawali. She was one of the party MPs to suggest that Shiv Sena ally with the BJP. Earlier in the day, Sena MLA Gulabrao Patil claimed that 12 party MPs would soon join the faction led by CM Eknath Shinde.

359.title: Irani, Scindia assigned additional portfolios after 2 Union Ministers resign
359.article_body: Union Minister Smriti Irani has been assigned the charge of Ministry of Minority Affairs in addition to her existing portfolio of Women and Child Development after Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi's resignation. Meanwhile, Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia has been assigned the additional charge of Ministry of Steel charge after Union Minister RCP Singh resigned.

360.title: Crisis-hit Sri Lanka seeks credit support from Russia to import fuel
360.article_body: Sri Lanka's President Gotabaya Rajapaksa on Wednesday said that he had requested credit support from Russia to help the cash-strapped nation import fuel amid a severe economic crisis. Rajapaksa made the request during a call with Russian President Vladimir Putin. Separately, Sri Lanka plans to hold road shows in five Indian cities to attract more tourists, its Tourism Minister said.

361.title: Avoid non-essential travel to Sri Lanka: New Zealand tells citizens
361.article_body: Amid Sri Lanka's ongoing economic crisis, New Zealand on Wednesday issued a travel advisory asking citizens to avoid non-essential travel to the cash-strapped country. The advisory stated that travellers should have contingency plans as they might face a shortage of supplies, including food and fuel. New Zealand citizens residing in Sri Lanka were also asked to avoid protest sites.

362.title: Athlete PT Usha, composer Ilaiyaraaja, 2 others nominated to Rajya Sabha
362.article_body: Former Olympic Track and Field Athlete PT Usha, music composer Ilaiyaraaja, filmmaker Vijayendra Prasad and philanthropist Veerendra Heggade were nominated to Rajya Sabha on Wednesday. PM Narendra Modi took to Twitter to congratulate them. "The remarkable PT Usha Ji is an inspiration for every Indian," he wrote for the athlete. "Glad that he has been nominated," he wrote for Ilaiyaraaja.

363.title: Punishing a nuclear power is threat to humanity: Ex-Russia Prez to US
363.article_body: Ex-Russian President Dmitry Medvedev told the US on Wednesday that attempts by the West to punish Russia over its military offensive in Ukraine risked threatening humanity. "Punishing a country that has one of the largest nuclear potentials is absurd," Medvedev added. Notably, Russia and US possess about 90% of the world's nuclear warheads, according to a US-based think tank.

364.title: Pant becomes highest-ranked Indian Test batter, achieves his career-best ranking
364.article_body: Team India wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant has become the highest-ranked Indian Test batter in the latest rankings. The 24-year-old has moved six places to the fifth position to achieve his highest-ever position in the rankings for Test batters. Team India captain Rohit Sharma, who is ranked ninth, is the second-highest ranked Indian Test batter.

365.title: Man shares pics showing price difference between Zomato online & offline bills
365.article_body: A LinkedIn user has made a comparison of Zomato online and offline food bills of the same order. Rahul Kabra, a Performance Marketing Manager, shared the photos and wrote, "Cost escalation 34.76% per order at INR 178 = (690-512)/512." "Assuming Zomato brings visibility and more orders to the food service provider, should it charge such high price?" he added.

366.title: I've been in constant touch with officials: PM amid Assam floods
366.article_body: Amid the ongoing flood situation in Assam, PM Narendra Modi said, "Assam is facing the challenges of floods. Normal life has been affected. CM Himanta Biswa Sarma and his team are working continuously on relief operations." "I've been in constant touch with...officials and the people in Assam," he added. So far, over 170 people have died in Assam amid floods.

367.title: I want to play a superhero of Indian origin in Avengers: Taapsee Pannu
367.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu said she wants to play a superhero. "Please ask Marvel...this is the only wish list I have," she added. "I want to be a part of Avengers, I want to play...superhero of Indian origin. That’s all I'm trying to manifest. So if anyone tells me a way to go about it, I'll follow it," Taapsee said.

368.title: Nigerian arrested with 80 grams of cocaine worth ₹24 lakh in Mumbai
368.article_body: Police said that a 32-year-old Nigerian national, Chukwuma Ogbonna Nwaeke, was arrested with 80 grams of cocaine worth ₹24 lakh by Anti-Narcotics Cell (ANC) of Mumbai crime branch. Nwaeke, who was moving suspiciously in Santacruz area, started running after seeing the police vehicle and was arrested after a chase, an official said, adding he was carrying a bag containing cocaine.

369.title: 4 women who tricked & robbed train passengers arrested in Aurangabad
369.article_body: Four women, who were a part of a notorious gang robbing long-distance railway passengers of their belongings, were arrested by Government Railway Police (GRP) crime branch in Aurangabad on Wednesday. Officers said the women would travel to Mumbai from Aurangabad every two or three days. "They would...board different, random long-distance trains pretending to be travelling alone," police said.

370.title: Ensure constant supply of sanitary pads in schools: HC to Delhi govt
370.article_body: The Delhi High Court has directed the Delhi government to ensure a constant supply of sanitary napkins to girl students in government-aided schools under the Kishori Yojana scheme. The Directorate of Education informed the court that an e-tender had been floated for this. School authorities had been given funds to procure sanitary napkins from the government's e-marketplace, DoE said.

371.title: Expecting 4 cr pilgrims to visit U'khand during Kanwar Yatra: CM
371.article_body: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami on Wednesday said the government is expecting as many as four crore pilgrims to visit the state during the upcoming Kanwar Yatra. "We'll ensure a hassle-free journey for all," Dhami said, while speaking at Uttarakhand Startup Conclave and Grand Challenge 2022. "Pilgrims are partaking in the ongoing Char Dham Yatra in record-breaking numbers," he added.

372.title: Elephant birth blocks Kerala-Tamil Nadu road for 1 hour
372.article_body: A road connecting Kerala and Tamil Nadu in Idukki district was blocked for an hour as an elephant was giving birth in the middle of the road, a forest department official said. The road was blocked by the herd as the mother gave birth, preventing vehicular movement. After the mother walked away with her calf, the road was cleared.

373.title: 2 boys, aged 6 & 9, drown in a village pond in MP's Damoh district
373.article_body: Two minor boys, aged six and nine years, drowned in a village pond while they were playing in Madhya Pradesh's Damoh, police said on Wednesday. The boys had left their homes in the afternoon and did not return till late evening, after which their families started looking for them, police said. Their bodies were found floating in the pond.

374.title: Actor Rana Jung Bahadur arrested for making objectionable remarks against Lord Valmiki
374.article_body: Actor Rana Jung Bahadur was arrested on Wednesday, a day after a court in Punjab's Jalandhar rejected his anticipatory bail plea, for allegedly making objectionable remarks against Lord Valmiki on a TV show. His remarks had led to protests in Jalandhar, with members of Valmiki community also calling for a bandh on July 11.

375.title: Australian tennis star Nick Kyrgios charged with assaulting ex-girlfriend
375.article_body: Australian tennis star Nick Kyrgios will appear before a Canberra court next month after being charged with assaulting his ex-girlfriend last year, local police said on Tuesday. If found guilty, Kyrgios could face a maximum sentence of two years in prison, reports said. Kyrgios' lawyer confirmed that the 27-year-old will make a statement in due course.

376.title: Speech fabricated to weaken LDF: Saji after resigning as Kerala Minister
376.article_body: After resigning from the Kerala Cabinet, Saji Cherian said he never defamed the Constitution. "I have resigned and it's my personal decision...A particular part from the speech was taken and the media fabricated it to weaken the CPI(M) and the LDF," he said. Cherian resigned amid protests over his remarks on the Constitution.

377.title: Modi ji's gift to Indian households: KTR on LPG price hike
377.article_body: Telangana IT Minister KT Rama Rao criticised Prime Minister Narendra Modi-led central government for the increase in gas cylinder prices and said it was Modi ji's gift to all Indian households. "LPG over ₹1,050. An increase again of ₹50," he tweeted. His comment comes after the price of a 14.2-kg domestic LPG cylinder was increased by ₹50 today.

378.title: Landslide near Pratapgad fort in Maharashtra, no casualty reported
378.article_body: A landslide occurred on a road leading to the Pratapgad fort in Maharashtra's Satara district on Wednesday after heavy rains. No casualty was reported, according to officials of Satara district administration. "After receiving information, our team reached the spot and cleared the debris from the road," Public Works Department's executive engineer, Sanjay Sonawane, said.

379.title: Authorities nab 39 suspects over migrant smuggling on boats to UK
379.article_body: At least 39 suspects allegedly involved in the smuggling of migrants via boats to UK have been arrested by authorities in a Europe-wide operation. The suspects have been accused of smuggling as many as 10,000 people on small boats across English Channel to UK. Notably, this comes months after 27 UK-bound migrants drowned off France's coast after their boat capsized.

380.title: Dolo-650 manufacturer's Bengaluru office raided by Income Tax Department
380.article_body: The Income Tax Department on Wednesday conducted searches at the premises of Bengaluru-based pharmaceutical company Micro Labs Ltd, the manufacturers of Dolo-650 tablet, on charges of tax evasion, officials said. They added that the department is looking at financial documents, balance sheets and business distributor networks of the company as part of the searches.

381.title: Ranbir Kapoor and Vaani have sensual chemistry in Shamshera: Karan Malhotra
381.article_body: Speaking about Ranbir Kapoor and Vaani Kapoor in 'Shamshera', filmmaker Karan Malhotra said, "Ranbir and Vaani have sensual chemistry...Their characters were written in a way to show how attraction leads to love and how...their love blooms in crisis." "Our song 'Fitoor', will show their dynamic chemistry, and I hope people love how...gorgeous they look together," he said.

382.title: Tendulkar shares pic with Ranveer on his b'day, says 'Any guesses when this was clicked?'
382.article_body: Former Indian cricketer Sachin Tendulkar took to Instagram to share an old picture with actor Ranveer Singh on the occasion of his birthday on Wednesday. "Happy Birthday, Ranveer! Have a great year ahead. Found this picture of ours...Any guesses when this was clicked?" he wrote in the caption. The photo also features Ranveer's father Jagjit Singh Bhavnani.

383.title: Virat Kohli records his worst Test ranking in 6 years, drops out of top 10
383.article_body: Ex-Team India captain Virat Kohli has recorded his worst Test ranking in around six years after dropping out of the top 10. Kohli managed scores of 11 and 20 against England in the Edgbaston Test and dropped to the 13th position in the latest rankings for Test batters. The last time Kohli was ranked below 10 was in November 2016.

384.title: Junior can marry only after elder brother: Raghav Chadha to Punjab CM
384.article_body: AAP leader Raghav Chadha extended his wishes to party colleague and Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann ahead of his wedding. Sharing a photo with Mann, Chadha said junior's number comes only after elder brother. He added, "Best wishes to my [big brother] Mann Saab and Dr Gurpreet Kaur for a happy and blessed married life." Mann will get married on Thursday.

385.title: Nepal's Finance Minister resigns amid parliamentary probe
385.article_body: Nepal's Finance Minister Janardan Sharma resigned on Wednesday after the formation of an 11-member parliamentary committee to probe allegations of unauthorised changes to the federal budget. Sharma is accused of inviting unauthorised persons to make changes to tax rates in the budget for fiscal year 2022-23. The changes were allegedly made a day before the budget was presented in Parliament.

386.title: PM Modi's weak China policy will cost India for decades: Owaisi
386.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Wednesday said that PM Narendra Modi's weak China policy will cost India for decades. His response came after the Centre approved 80 foreign direct investment proposals from Chinese entities. "After restricting Chinese investments in India, Modi has now done a u-turn and started approving FDI proposals from China," he added.

387.title: Smoke detected inside IndiGo flight after landing in Indore
387.article_body: Smoke was detected in the cabin of a Raipur-Indore IndiGo flight after landing on Tuesday, the aviation regulator Directorate General of Civil Aviation said on Wednesday. All the passengers were able to deboard from the A320 Neo aircraft safely, and the incident is being investigated by DGCA, according to reports.

388.title: Complaint filed against Nawazuddin's wife for not paying dues of ₹31 lakh: Reports
388.article_body: A police complaint has reportedly been filed against Nawazuddin Siddiqui’s wife Aaliya Siddiqui by Manju Garhwal, co-producer of her debut production venture, over non-payment of Rs 31 lakh dues. In her complaint, Garhwal alleged she has been trying to communicate with Aaliya but she isn't responding. Manju also accused Aaliya of causing her mental agony and harassment, reports added.

389.title: Authorities order mass COVID-19 testing in parts of Shanghai, Beijing
389.article_body: Chinese authorities have ordered a new round of mass COVID-19 testing in parts of Shanghai and Beijing after the discovery of new cases in the two cities. This comes as tight restrictions remain in place in Hong Kong, Macao and some other Chinese cities. Notably, Shanghai had ended its strict coronavirus lockdown a few weeks ago.

390.title: Indian Coast Guard rescues 22 ship crew members near Gujarat coast
390.article_body: Indian Coast Guard on Wednesday rescued 22 crew members of a sinking ship off the coast of Gujarat, which was on its way to Karnataka from UAE. The crew members were rescued after they issued a distress alert as their ship, MT Global King, started flooding. Among those rescued are 20 Indians and one Pakistani and Sri Lankan national each.

391.title: We've become laboratory of human rights violations: WB Guv
391.article_body: West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar on Wednesday said that the state is becoming a laboratory of human rights violations and urged the Bengali intelligentsia to break their silence on the "decimation of democratic values". "The greatest threat to democracy and which we cannot allow to happen is extreme appeasement," he further added.

392.title: Headlines managed, economy mismanaged: Rahul after LPG price hike
392.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi criticised the Centre over the price hike of LPG cylinders by ₹50 and accused the BJP government of managing headlines, but mismanaging the economy. He added that in 2014, inflation used to be the headline, but now there's no discussion of the LPG price hike, even when it has become costlier by ₹50.

393.title: PM Modi to inaugurate 3-day seminar on NEP in Varanasi on July 7
393.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will inaugurate a three-day seminar on the implementation of the National Education Policy (NEP) across the country, in Varanasi on Thursday. The event, which is being organised by the Union Education Ministry, will see over 300 senior dignitaries in attendance. UP CM Yogi Adityanath and Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan will be present on the occasion.

394.title: Woman passenger conceals 1kg gold in rectum, caught at Hyd airport
394.article_body: A woman passenger was caught by the Hyderabad Customs officials for trying to smuggle over 1kg of gold, officials said. The gold was valued at ₹64.38 lakh and was concealed in her rectum, which was later caught by the air intelligence unit of the Hyderabad Customs, reports said. Further investigation is underway, officials added.

395.title: Hyd woman accused of running brothels detained under PD Act
395.article_body: A woman who has been accused of running prostitution rings was detained under the Preventive Detention Act and was sent to Hyderabad's Chanchalguda prison. Rachakonda Police Commissioner Mahesh Bhagwat invoked the PD Act against the accused woman, who has been involving women and young girls from Mumbai, Andhra Pradesh, Karnataka and other regions into prostitution.

396.title: India's coal production rises 32.57% year-on-year in June 2022
396.article_body: The Ministry of Coal on Wednesday said that the coal production has risen by 32.57% to 67.59 million tonnes (MT) in June 2022 from 50.98 MT in June 2021. Likewise, coal-based power generation registered a growth of 26.58% in June 2022 as compared to June 2021. The overall power generation in June 2022 was 17.73% higher year-on-year, it added.

397.title: Food Ministry calls meeting of edible oil firms for reduction in prices
397.article_body: The Food Ministry has called a meeting on Wednesday with edible oil companies to discuss reduction in the MRPs of cooking oils, Food Secretary Sudhanshu Pandey said. He added, "We'll tell them to pass on the benefits of reduction in global prices...to consumers." In the last one month, global prices have reportedly fallen $300-$450 per tonnes of different edible oils.

398.title: Kerala Minister Saji Cherian resigns amid protest over anti-Constitution remark
398.article_body: Kerala Culture Minister Saji Cherian on Wednesday announced his resignation from the state Cabinet amid protests over his remarks on the Constitution. He had said that the Indian Constitution endorses the exploitation and loot of the common people. He later expressed regret and said, "I respect our Constitution...The news that I criticised the Constitution is twisted."

399.title: Passenger safety is paramount: Scindia as SpiceJet gets notice over snags
399.article_body: After the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) issued a show cause notice to SpiceJet over the recent malfunction incidents, Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya M Scindia said passenger safety is paramount. "Even the smallest error hindering safety will be thoroughly investigated and course-corrected," he added. The airline has reported eight malfunction incidents in the last 18 days.

400.title: Nepotism refuses to leave me, I'm still cursed, trolled & abused for it: Karan
400.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar spoke about nepotism and revealed the topic refused to leave him. "It started on...(Koffee With Karan) and that's never the industry, it's never left social media, by and large, I'm still cursed, trolled, and abused for it," he said. "Now I'm not bothered. It went from annoyance to amusement. Now I'm amused every time," he added.
